revised_title: Electrical Properties and Phase Transformations of Graphite Nitrates: A Study on Hybrid Crystal Structures
tldr: The author investigates the electrical properties and phase transformations of graphite nitrates, discovering that they behave as good conductors of electricity. The study reveals novel features about the order-disorder transformation taking place around the A point, with definite hysteresis and a large positive excess thermo-electric potential. The findings are interpreted in terms of a general theory of phase transformations involving intermediate hybrid structures with domains of the two forms coexistent in the A region of temperatures.
